definition: to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: I was a little tired yesterday, but I'm OK now.
sentences.chinese: 昨天还有点累，现在没事儿了。

sentences.english: We had just gotten to America and everybody else had gotten off.
sentences.chinese: 我们刚刚到达美国，别的人都没事儿。

sentences.english: 'Don't worry,' I say to my wife.
That's all right, sis, " he answered jovially ."
sentences.chinese: “没事儿，姐姐，”他快活地回答，钱用了又会来的。

sentences.english: I have trouble sleeping nights without a job.
sentences.chinese: 没事儿干，我晚上连觉都睡不好。

sentences.english: 'Don't worry, ' I say to my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉我父母说‘没事儿’。

sentences.english: Don't worry my love, go with the breakdown van !
sentences.chinese: 没事儿，亲爱的，坐救援车走吧。

sentences.english: If you tell me the truth, you won't get in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 你跟我实话实说，我保你没事儿。

sentences.english: A:The good news is the other 3 DVDs are ok.
sentences.chinese: 好消息是你借我的其它三DVD都没事儿。

sentences.english: It's a piece of cake. Why not invite the Kongfu master Wu Song to give us a hand ?
sentences.chinese: 没事儿，咱请功夫了得的武松助我一臂之力。

sentences.english: Don't worry, I was speaking to myself.
sentences.chinese: 没事儿，别担心，我刚在自言自语呢。

sentences.english: I sit there in idle, and I edit some code.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在那儿没事儿干，我编辑了一段代码。

definition: it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
